name: Blazer Course
description: OVER 5.5hrs of Step by Step Video Lessons on Constructing, Fitting and Finishing a Blazer! *Note: Please make sure you read carefully through the entire post on the blog if you have questions. When you purchase this course you will get an email instantly, click on the link in that email and it will open a PDF file that you SAVE to your computer. That PDF file contains EVERYTHING you need to access the video files and more including: Tools, Fabric suggestions, Pattern Suggestions, Plus Size Options, Tips and of course the Link and Password to the Videos You can start this course at ANY TIME and the videos will remain accessible to you to view as often as you wish. Part 1. Pattern guidelines & Taking measurements Choosing your size & Cutting the paper pattern Measuring the paper pattern against you RTW clothes Transferring paper pattern to muslin (Muslin is used to create a "test" that we will use to make fitting adjustments until a good fit is reached) Cutting and Pinning the Muslin Part 2. Sewing and Fitting the Muslin Transferring our muslin back to paper to create a clean pattern that you can keep and reuse Cut our pieces from the fashion fabric Reviewing the construction, interfacings and structure of a blazer Start building the structure for our blazer Part 3. Transfer any necessary fit adjustments we made to our pattern pieces to our lining pieces Create a lining if there is no lining for the pattern Cut and sew our lining pieces Decide on any design details for the blazer Part 4. Sewing our blazer Attaching a collar and lapel Creating bound buttonholes Part 5. Making any further adjustments Attaching our lining Hand finishing the blazer

name: Off The Shoulder Dress w/ Short Option Tutorial
description:
Step by Step VIDEO Tutorial. 
Great for Beginners and Intermediate Seamstresses.

READ!! The PDF file attached in the email you will receive after placing your order it contains all the information needed to access your tutorial. The email is sent instantly so please also check your spam folder. MAKE SURE TO SAVE THE PDF to your computer.

There is NO VIDEO DOWNLOADING required and access does not expire but the PDF download link will so you must save it in order to access the tutorial in future. 

My Step-by Step Video Tutorials are extremely detailed and I show you every step while we "sew together" I make sure to explain why I am doing something and what the benefit is and I cover all the necessary tools and fabric suggestions in the video and in the PDF.

My goal is to make sure that I keep the process clear and easy for everyone to follow no matter the skill level.
